ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Intermediate grammar, a wide range of vocab, increased speaking, reading, and writing skills.

I basically learned how to speak Korean haha. Before this class, I could barely speak (just the basic phrases), but after taking this class, I'm able to write essays and speak more (confidently)! We learned a lot of important Korean grammar.

Other than the course material, I have gained a deeper insight about the way I ultimately learn and study best. I found out what worked and what did not work when trying to review and learn new material. In terms of the course, I developed a richer understanding about korean culture and history and a deeper appreciation for the language.
I learned new grammar patterns, expanded my current dictionary of vocabulary, and significantly became more comfortable with both speaking and listening to dialogues in Korean.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Being a little more clear with the assignments and due dates.

Strengths: I think you learn a lot with Choi ssn because she's on the stricter side, but she keeps you accountable to learning, which I appreciated. She's also a pretty chill grader. We learned important Korean grammar.

Weaknesses: Choi ssn was pretty disorganized with the schedule in terms of when things were due and what daily assessments covered. She also kept changing her mind about what the final project consisted of.

Strengths: Incredible consistency in teaching techniques not only with daily speaking exercises in class, but homework twice-three times a week which increased my engagement with the course. All the projects and assessments were also highly interesting and always peaked the curiosity of the students, therefore we were always excited to let our creative freedom help us better understand the topics at hand. 

Weaknesses: Absolutely no weakness, terrific course!

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Definitely, as long as you're willing to put the work in to learn vocabulary and grammar and practice speaking and writing.

ABSOLUTELY NO QUESTIONS ASKED!! This is a phenomenal course taught by a professor who always shows her love for teaching Korean in every class. Would highly recommend continuing with Korean by taking this class!
